headline: Electronic Arts (NasdaqGS:EA) Projects US$7.1 Billion Revenue For Fiscal Year 2026
summary: Electronic Arts (NasdaqGS:EA) recently provided new guidance and positive fourth-quarter earnings, alongside a quarterly dividend declaration, all of which coincided with an 18% price increase over the last quarter. This performance reflects investor recognition of improved quarterly results from $1,895 million in sales and $254 million net income. These developments occurred against a mixed market backdrop, with overall stocks seeing varied responses to earnings reports and tariff...

headline: Electronic Arts Stock Rises After Earnings. Wall Street Disagrees on What’s Next.
summary: Electronic Arts  posted better-than-expected earnings for the March quarter, but not everyone on Wall Street is convinced shares of the videogame publisher will climb much further this year.  EA shares were up 0.4% at $155.08 Wednesday, while the  slipped narrowly.  Both videogame players and investors were excited to hear that EA will release the highly anticipated new installment of the Battlefield franchise in the current fiscal year, which ends in March 2026.

headline: How tariffs are making gaming, consoles more expensive
summary: Imported technology, namely laptops, tablets, and video games, could see significant price increases over US tariffs, according to new Consumer Technology Association (CTA) data. Yahoo Finance tech editor Dan Howley comes on Wealth to expand upon the price hikes seen from major video game developers, like Microsoft (MSFT) and Nintendo (NTDOY, 7974.T), and the impacts that higher prices and even game delays — namely Take-Two Interactive's (TTWO) Grand Theft Auto VI — will have on the gaming industry. To watch more expert insights and analysis on the latest market action, check out more Wealth here.

headline: Electronic Arts raised by HSBC after strong quarter, MoffettNathanson cuts rating
summary: Investing.com -- Electronic Arts received mixed reactions from Wall Street following its fiscal fourth-quarter earnings, with HSBC upgrading the stock to Buy while MoffettNathanson downgraded it to Neutral, citing valuation concerns.

headline: EA shares gain as it scores big with upbeat forecast, 'Battlefield' release
summary: EA's forecast underscores the gaming industry's confidence in sustained sales strength, even as U.S. tariffs stir up economic uncertainty and put consumer wallets to the test.  The upbeat forecast follows concerns about FC 25's performance, as the formerly FIFA-branded soccer franchise showed signs of slowing momentum and hints of player fatigue in a highly competitive market.  EA also announced the launch of "Battlefield", stepping in just as Take Two Interactive pushes the release of the long-awaited "Grand Theft Auto VI" beyond fiscal 2026.

headline: Electronic Arts always lands on its feet
summary: After a lackluster third quarter, the US software publisher ended FY 2025 on a high note, with a rebound in sales and a 2026 outlook that already has the markets salivating.

headline: Compared to Estimates, Electronic Arts (EA) Q4 Earnings: A Look at Key Metrics
summary: While the top- and bottom-line numbers for Electronic Arts (EA) give a sense of how the business performed in the quarter ended March 2025, it could be worth looking at how some of its key metrics compare to Wall Street estimates and year-ago values.
